name: Script DAT
description: The Script DAT runs a script each time the DAT cooks and can build/modify the output table based in the optional input tables. The Script DAT is created with a docked (attached) DAT that contains three Python methods: cook, onPulse, and setupParameters. The cook method is run each time the Script DAT cooks. The setupParameters method is run whenever the Setup Parameter button on the Script page is pressed. The onPulse method is run whenever a custom pulse parameter is pushed.

parameters.name: Callbacks DAT
parameters.label: Callbacks DAT
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The   runs a script each time the  cooks and can build/modify the output table based in the optional input tables. The   is created with a docked (attached)  that contains three Python methods: cook, onPulse, and setupParameters. The cook method is run each time the   cooks. The setupParameters method is run whenever the Setup Parameter button on the  page is pressed. The onPulse method is run whenever a custom pulse parameter is pushed.		
Refer to Help -> Python Examples, and Help -> Operator Snippets.			
Note: Because the   can get data from anywhere, it's difficult to determine what it procedurally depends on. So every time that any  OP runs it will add to a list of operators, parameters, nodes etc that it depends upon, and when they change, the  OP will re-cook. The list is reset when a  restarts.	
See also: Script CHOP, Script SOP, Script TOP
scriptDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  callbacks - Specifies the  which holds the callbacks. See scriptDAT_Class for usage.


		
  setuppars - Clicking the button runs the setupParameters() callback function.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. language - pick extension from DATs script language. custom - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



 -

Extra Information for the   can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of rows in this . - Number of columns in this .
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

A set of commands located in a Text DAT that are triggered to run under certain conditions. There are two scripting languages in TouchDesigner: Python and the original Tscript. Scripts and single-line commands can also be run in the Textport.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



TOuch Environment file, the file type used by TouchDesigner to save your entire project.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Script_DAT&oldid=25276"
		Category: DATs
